thread.title: Spieth to headline returning Singapore Open
thread.title_full: Spieth to headline returning Singapore Open

author: ‘Clock kid’ and family will move to Qatar
title: Spieth to headline returning Singapore Open
text:
Spieth to headline returning Singapore Open AFP 1 day ago © Provided by AFP (FILES) Jordan Spieth of the United States plays a bunker shot on the 16th hole during the final round of the 2015 PGA Championship at Whistling Straits on August 16, 2015. Spieth, the 2015 USPGA Tour player of the year, will headline the Singapore Open in January 2016 when it returns after a three-year absence, organisers said October 20, 2015. Richard Heathcote/Getty Images/AFP USPGA Tour player of the year Jordan Spieth will headline the Singapore Open in January when it returns after a three-year absence, organisers said Tuesday.
AdChoices The 22-year-old world number two, who counts the Masters and US Open among five wins during a breakout 2015, said he was "really looking forward" to playing the tournament.
"I'm very fortunate to play golf around the world and can't wait to visit Singapore for the first time," Spieth said in a statement.
Under a three-year deal with Japan's Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, the SMBC Singapore Open will offer a minimum prize fund of $1 million and will be held at Sentosa Golf Club from January 28-31. It is jointly sanctioned by the Asian Tour and the Japan Golf Tour Organisation.
